list.name: Changes
list.comment: We have set up the email system to notify bidders when a winner has been chosen for respective auction, and we are now working on a sms text system currently

task.summary: Default task
We are starting a project in which we will be developing and auctioning system
We are starting a project in which we will be developing and auctioning system
We are starting a project in which we will be developing and auctioning system
We have successfully given the user the ability to add an auction, to be able to also log in and register. The next goal is to display the auctions on the page

We are still making edits to our auction page. We have edited the register function in our views so that it automatically creates a profile for each registered user. We also are working on the profile page to allow users to view their profile. More aspects to come as this is just a rough draft

We are still making edits to our auction page. We have edited the register function in our views so that it automatically creates a profile for each registered user. We also are working on the profile page to allow users to view their profile. More aspects to come as this is just a rough draft

We have created a template for updating the users profile, we are still working out a few bugs and playing around with the media roots as well.Once we get the profile stuff done, the goal is to start working on the bidding system.
We have successfully fixed the update form for the users profile and are now working on the bid attribute of the project, allowing users to place their bids on auctions of their choice.

We have created a page where the auctioneer can see all the bids on their auction, and we have set the view bids button option to appear only if it is the auctioneer that is logged in, and we have set the place bid button to appear if only if anyone other than the auctioneer is logged in. Next we will try to give the users anonymous names and also potentially give the bidders the ability to see the current winning bid

We have created a page where the auctioneer can see all the bids on their auction, and we have set the view bids button option to appear only if it is the auctioneer that is logged in, and we have set the place bid button to appear if only if anyone other than the auctioneer is logged in. Next we will try to give the users anonymous names and also potentially give the bidders the ability to see the current winning bid
We have started a new project, following a tutorial and learning how to use rest_framework in django code
We have started a new project, following a tutorial and learning how to use rest_framework in django code
We have started to install our required installations from npm as per the tutorial.

We have set up our index.html page for rendering, we have also set up a new app called frontend, and we have also set up our React file page as well and set up a div class that the React file can render its stuff inside of

We have set up our index.html page for rendering, we have also set up a new app called frontend, and we have also set up our React file page as well and set up a div class that the React file can render its stuff inside of

We have now set up a routing system in our HomePage.js in order to flip through the various components that we render. We are also creating a serializer that will check and see if the post request made for the creation of a room is valid so that we can send over the details requested for this creation of the room
We have established a create view where users can now create rooms, and we have some validity and session checks that are also put into place as well
We are working on creating the page for the frontend in which the user can interact with the UI to create their room
We have successfully created the room creation front end page, and we have also connected the frontend to the back end api that will create the room based off of the users input
We have successfully created the room creation front end page, and we have also connected the frontend to the back end api that will create the room based off of the users input
We have successfully created the room creation front end page, and we have also connected the frontend to the back end api that will create the room based off of the users input
We are now setting up a page to display teh details of a room
We are now setting up a page to display the details of a room
We have successfully set up the display page for the rooms, and also have made it so that the users are automatically sent to that page after they create a room
We have now set up the join page that allows users to join a room, however, we are still working out a few bugs with the join room and the api that handles the join room function
We have now set up the join page that allows users to join a room, however, we are still working out a few bugs with the join room and the api that handles the join room function
We have now stylized our home page and are creating a check system to see if the user is already in a room so that we can just automatically send them to the room when the homepage renders

We are editing the code so that when the user does leave the room or if the room no longer exist, we will wipe it from the homepage so that they won't accidentally be sent there. Stil working out a few bugs though
We are working on creating an update page to allow users to update the fields of the current room

We have now added an api that is able to connect with spotify, we however are encountering some issues with our security which is blocking spotify from connecting with our local server to give us our data of interest, so we will be working on that to see how we can have the security allow a connection with spotify

We have now added an api that is able to connect with spotify, we however are encountering some issues with our security which is blocking spotify from connecting with our local server to give us our data of interest, so we will be working on that to see how we can have the security allow a connection with spotify

We have made edits to the auction page, added some styling, we have also added a review page to allow users to see review, we have also allowed users to see the highest current bid. We have created a binlog in our database which will allow users to track the auctions that they have won (still a work in progress). We also will develop a chat feature as well as we have made the buttons for the auctioneer to chat with the user and select a bid that wins
We are working on setting uo the process where the auctioneer can give the item to whoever wins the auction or whomever he deems to win the auction. Sorting out some bugs currently though
We are working on setting uo the process where the auctioneer can give the item to whoever wins the auction or whomever he deems to win the auction. Sorting out some bugs currently though

We have successfully set upt the bid log feature and are now going to see if we can start working on the reviews feature and are adding some css styling as well to make the website looking more appealing

We are currently working on the review page, we have set up the backend function that will handle all the reviews that are submitted, now we just need to set up the frontend where the user can submit their review to the system.
We have successfully added the reviews section, and later we will be adding a feature that allows users to see all the reviews
We made some edits to the review class and also edited how the details page looks a little bit

We have fixed the authentication issues with spotify and connecting to the server. Users can now log in and have their music data read by the code, but we are working out an issue regarding displaying the actual data retrieved from the users spotify account and trying to fix a reloading error
We have fixed the displaying of the spotify data, now we are just tweaking the format to edit how we are presenting the data.
We are adding the pause, skip, and play function attributes

We are now working on an admit system that will give the user the ability to make their room public or private, and we have created a UsersInRoom data table that will keep track of who is in what room

We are now working on an admit system that will give the user the ability to make their room public or private, and we have created a UsersInRoom data table that will keep track of who is in what room
we are working on displaying all the users within a music room
we are working on displaying all the users within a music room via a new component
we are working on displaying all the users within a music room via a new component
Working on an email system for my auction website to allow users to reset their password if they would like
Working on an email system for my auction website to allow users to reset their password if they would like
We have set up the email system to notify bidders when a winner has been chosen for respective auction, and we are now working on a sms text system currently
